issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

fields.summary: Phase out the old web UI in HDFS

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: webhdfs
components.description: WebHDFS: HTTP REST API for HDFS

fields.description:
It is possible to steal or manipulate customer session and cookies, which might be used to impersonate a legitimate user,
allowing the hacker to view or alter user records, and to perform transactions as that user.
e.g.
GET /browseDirectory.jsp? dir=%2Fhadoop'"/><script>alert(759)</script> &namenodeInfoPort=50070

Also;

Phishing Through Frames

Try:
GET /browseDirectory.jsp? dir=%2Fhadoop%27%22%3E%3Ciframe+src%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Fdemo.testfire.net%2Fphishing.html%3E
&namenodeInfoPort=50070 HTTP/1.1
Cookie: JSESSIONID=qd9i8tuccuam1cme71swr9nfi
Accept-Language: en-US
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;
fields.summary: Site Scripting and Phishing Through Frames in browseDirectory.jsp

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/5223//console

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks Jeff for reporting the bug and Vivek for working on it. 

OTOH, the patch is incorrect. Please use escapeHtml properly.
Looks like the issue only Hadoop 1.x. We should simply backport HDFS-4162.
Blocker for the next 1.x release.
Somebody please share with me the process of contributing patches to 1.x branches.  Is there any wiki page available for the same?

I think the answer is probably no. Basically, you should switch branch from trunk to branch-1 and setup build env by following: http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/BuildingHadoopFromSVN. When your env is ready to go, do changes and run ant test and paste your test results (not increasing new failures or warnings) in JIRA. The committer will review your patch based on your changes and result. I think this is current branch-1 process.

Refer: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hadoop-hdfs-dev/201308.mbox/%3CCADdVdVHYSnXOxUB2t8kKnwATA8QYg6z4ycWJmcAWQahwEyupdw@mail.gmail.com%3E

Cancelling patch and moving JIRA status accordingly.

Refer: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hadoop-hdfs-dev/201308.mbox/%3CCADdVdVHYSnXOxUB2t8kKnwATA8QYg6z4ycWJmcAWQahwEyupdw@mail.gmail.com%3E

Closing this issue as "Won't fix"
[~vivganes]: You might not want to work on this, but this is still a blocker for 1.x. BTW, the mailing list thread is about HDFS-2933 and not relevant to this Jira.

[~vicaya] Oops sorry to have closed the wrong issue. my bad :( I am willing to work on this issue. can I reassign this issue to myself?  Since that mail talked about branch-1,  got confused between this jira and hdfs-2933, which seems to have been closed already
[~vivganes]: no problem, feel free to assign it to yourself, if you want to work on it.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12627367/HDFS-4901_branch-1.2.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:red}-1 patch{color}.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/6054//console

This message is automatically generated.

[~vicaya] I have uploaded a patch for branch 1.2, by porting HDFS-4162.  But Jenkins tries to apply the patch to trunk.  Is there any way to make Jenkins understand that the patch is for branch 1.2 and not trunk?

Can someone please help me in validating the patch for branch-1.2 locally on my machine? I am looking for some wiki/doc which contains instructions on how to build branch-1.2 and how to test patches, along with prerequisites, if any.
At this point, there is unlikely to be another 1.x release, given the last one will be a year ago tomorrow.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12627367/HDFS-4901_branch-1.2.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:red}-1 patch{color}.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/7523//console

This message is automatically generated.
Closing this jira. As [~aw] pointed out, it is unlikely that there will be another 1.x release. This is no longer an issue after HDFS-6252 is merged in branch-2.
